verses.verse: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I don't want you to be ignorant.
You fully know that you were Gentiles, carried away with these voiceless idols, even as you were lead.
Therefore I want you to understand that no one speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus cursed, and no one can say that Jesus is the Lord except by the Holy Spirit.
Now there are different gifts, but the same Spirit.
And there are different ministries, but the same Lord.
There are different results, but it is the same God who works all in all.
But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every one for the benefit [of all].
For the word of wisdom is given by the Spirit to one; to another the word of knowledge by that same Spirit.
To another faith by that same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by that same Spirit;
to another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to another discerning of spirits; to another variety of languages; to another the interpretation of languages.
But that one and same spirit works all these, dividing to every one individually just as he wants.
For as the body is one and has many members and all the members of that one body, even though many, are one body, even so is Christ.
For by one Spirit we are all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Gentiles, whether slave or free, and we all have drank from one Spirit.
For the body is not one member but many.
If the foot should say, "Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body"; is it therefore not of the body?
And if the ear should say, "Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body"; is it therefore not of the body?
If the whole body were an eye, where's the ear. If the whole were hearing, where's the sense of smelling.
But now God has set the members--every one of them--in the body as it has pleased him.
Now if they were all one member, where's the body?
Now there are many members, yet only one body.
But the eye can't say to the hand, I have no need of you, nor furthermore the head to the feet, I have no need of you.
No those parts of the body which seem to be weaker are much more necessary,
and those parts of the body, which we think, are less honorable we bestow special value on them, so our less beautiful parts end up having greater beauty,
for our beautiful parts have no need and so God has put together our body having given greater honor to that part, which didn't have it,
so that there would be no discord in the body, but that the members would have the same concern for each other.
If one part suffers, all parts suffer with it, or if one part is honored, all the parts rejoice with it.
Now you are the body of Christ and individual members [of it].
And so God has set some in the church, first apostles, secondly prophets, thirdly teaches, after that miracles, then gifts of healing, helps, moderators, [and] different languages.
Are all apostles, all prophets, all teachers, all miracle workers?
Do all have the gifts of healing? Not all speak [other] languages, do they? Not all interpret, do they?
But greatly desire the best gifts, and yet I show you a more excellent way.
